comments.body:
Is the behavior identical to the existing method if false?
Hm OK this is a little odd API-wise but I understand you're trying to keep compatibility while adding a better representation too. I'm neutral on it.

The existing method below seems like it had an OK purpose too, to return the results as objects rather than a DataFrame, but I also don't feel strongly about retaining it.

> Is the behavior identical to the existing method if false?

Yes, since all methods share the same logic to compute test results, the differences lie in how to represent the results.

> The existing method below seems like it had an OK purpose too, to return the results as objects rather than a DataFrame

I am neutral on keeping it or not. How do you @huaxingao think about it? I can add it back it you want it.
I am OK with the change.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +64,68 @@   * @param featuresCol  Name of features column in dataset, of type `Vector` (`VectorUDT`)
   * @param labelCol  Name of label column in dataset, of any numerical type
   * @param flatten  If false, the returned DataFrame contains only a single Row, otherwise, one
   *                 row per feature.
   */

comments.body: nit: do we need the ```groupBy()``` here?
